page.title: 01Donington Hall and Park
page.content: This area, mainly in the North-western corner of Leicestershire, is predominantly arable farmland and includes two villages, Wilson and Isley Walton. Wilson falls just within Leicestershire. The Derby/Leicestershire county boundary traverses northwards to the outskirts of Donington Park and continues around the western side of the latter before crossing the River Trent. The A453 Nottingham to Birmingham trunk road provides easy access to this area. An important feature of the area is Donington Hall and Park. The hall is now the headquarters of British Midland Airways and access to the park is strictly limited. About half of the area which was Donington Park is now Donington Park Racing Circuit including the Museum of Motor Racing.
